issues.title: jpa examples violate the hashCode()/equals() contract
issues.body:
Add this line at the end of `com.oreilly.springdata.jpa.core.CustomerRepositoryIntegrationTest.savesCustomerCorrectly()` test:
```
assertTrue(dave.getAddresses().contains(dave.getAddresses().iterator().next()));
```
The test will fail. Even though every Java developer reading this line will expect the test to pass.

This is because the example is implemented in a way that fields which are used for equals/hashCode (`id`) are modified after the object has been added to a `HashSet`.

issues.title: whether waitForLock  api can be removed?
issues.body:
Hi All: 
I got a question like this:
1. Why clear operation not use flushDB? Evict each key may be so slowly ? (@see xxx...RedisCache)
2. Why GET/PUT and other operations need to wait for a lock.If I remove this lock what will happen?(@see xxx...RedisCache)

issue_comments.body:

I got a question like this:
1. Why clear operation not use flushDB? evict each key may be so slowly ? (@see xxx...RedisCache)
2. Why GET/PUT and other operations need to wait for a lock.If I remove this lock what will happen?(@see xxx...RedisCache)
Waiting for ur response
Best Regards from Eric

issues.title: Unit tests using redisTemplate fail
issues.body:
KeyValueSerializersTest and CachingTest fail with:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: template not initialized; call afterPropertiesSet() before using it
    at org.springframework.util.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:65)
    at org.springframework.data.redis.core.RedisTemplate.execute(RedisTemplate.java:151)
    at org.springframework.data.redis.core.RedisTemplate.execute(RedisTemplate.java:137)
    at org.springframework.data.redis.core.AbstractOperations.execute(AbstractOperations.java:84)
    at org.springframework.data.redis.core.DefaultValueOperations.setIfAbsent(DefaultValueOperations.java:204)
    at com.oreilly.springdata.redis.KeyValueSerializersTest.testStringLongSerializers(KeyValueSerializersTest.java:34)

What needs to be done to initialize the redisTemplate?

issues.title: spring-data-redis ApplicationConfigTest fails
issues.body:
Instantiation of bean failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Could not instantiate bean class [com.oreilly.springdata.redis.ApplicationConfig]: Is it an abstract class?; nested exception is java.lang.InstantiationException.

When I remove abstract from public class ApplicationConfigTest {} the test works.  Was this an oversite or did I miss something?

commits.message: #3 - Upgraded to Mysema APT plugin in 1.0.8.
Set UTF-8 as build encoding.

Upgraded to Spring Data REST 1.1.0.M1.

Adapted configuration setup where necessary. Upgraded to Jetty 9 RC2 to be able to use Spring base class for WebApplicationInitializers. Upgraded sources to Jackson 2.

Upgraded to Spring Data Arora release train.

Upgraded to Spring Data JPA 1.3.0.RELEASE, Spring Data MongoDB 1.2.0.RELEASE, Spring Data Neo4j 2.2.0.RELEASE, Spring Data Gemfire 1.3.0.M1, Spring Data Redis 1.0.3.RELEASE.

Dependency updates.

Updated to Spring 3.2.1.RELEASE plus necessary additional dependency declarations. Moved repository declaration to Gemfire as it's only needed to pull in the Gemfire JAR. Upgraded to Hibernate 4.1.9, HSQLDB 2.2.9, QueryDsl 2.9.0. Upgraded plugin dependencies to compiler plugin 3.0, Surefire plugin 2.13.
Upgraded to Spring 3.2.0.RC1.
Upgraded to Querydsl 2.8.2.

Dependency updates - Upgraded to latest Spring Data releases.

Spring Data Gemfire - 1.2.1.RELEASE
Spring Data JPA - 1.2.0.RELEASE
Spring Data MongoDB - 1.1.1.RELEASE
Spring Data Neo4j - 2.1.0.RELEASE
Spring Data REST - 1.0.0.RELEASE

Polished Querydsl configuration to be consistent across modules.
JDBC - Updated generated query classes.
Dependencies - Updated to latest Spring Data module releases.

#2 - Restructured JavaConfig configuration classes to improve understandability.

Split up configuration classes into ApplicationConfig (enabling Spring Data JPA repositories), PlainJpaConfig (enabling component scanning to pick up the manual implementation) both sharing common infrastructure setup in InfrastructureConfig (setting up a DataSource, EntityManagerFactory and PlatformTRansactionManager).

This removes the need to use profiles and allows a clean separation of Spring Data JPA setup from the manual implementation one.
REST - Clean up logging configuration.
REST - Improved logging in SampleDataProvider.
Upgraded Jetty plugin to 8.1.7.
Updagrede to SLF4j 1.7.1.

Removed explicit dependency to Spring Hateoas in 0.2.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.

We're currently using the version transitively pull ind through Spring Data REST.
Polished isValid(…) method of EmailAddress value object.
Improved Querydsl setup.
Gemfire - Formatting.
Querydsl - Removed obsolete classes.
Upgraded to Spring 3.2.0.M2.
Gemfire - Removed obsolete file.
REST - Improve application configuration.
Logging - Include Logback as runtime dependency.
JPA - Improve application configuration.

Build - General dependency updates.

Querydsl - 2.6.0 -> 2.7.2
Hamcrest - 1.2.1 -> 1.3
Slf4j - 1.6.4 -> 1.6.6
Hibernate - 4.1.3.Final -> 4.1.6.Final
Spring Data JPA - 1.2.0.M1 -> 1.2.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT
Spring Data Neo4J - 2.1.0.RC1 -> 2.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT
Maven Compiler Plugin - 2.4 -> 2.5.1
Maven Surefire Plugin - 2.12 -> 2.12.2

Replaced explicit Hamcrest versions with property.
JPA - Fixed Querydsl setup.
Build - Remove duplicate Gemfire module declaration.
REST - Added sample clients accessing the exported repositories.
REST - Added Spring HATEOAS as dependency.
MongoDB - Added integration test for Querydsl usage.

Gemfire - Aligned project structure with the one of other modules.

Unified customer, product and core package. Renamed CustomerDao to GemfireCustomerRepository. Updated application JavaConfig and test configuration.
MongoDB - Added Querydsl sample.
JPA - Added Querydsl sample.
Mongo - Manual CustomerRepository implementation to show MongoTemplate usage.
Mongo - Using WriteConcern.SAFE to trigger DuplicateKeyException.
REST - Configure logging.
JPA, Mongo - Added additional constructor to Order.

Gemfire - Added Gemfire to modules.

Formatted pom.xml.

REST - Minor tweaks to sample code.

Removed returning attributes as immutable map. Added constructors taking a billing address to Order. Let CustomerRepository extend PagingAndSortingRepository to be able to explain collection pagination. Added @Param annotations to repository methods to be able to execute the methods via exposed resources.
REST - Removed obsolete dependency exclusion.
Polishing.

REST - Cleanups.

Polished JavaDoc of SampleDataProvider. Cleaned up XML files.
Updated .gitignore.
REST - Added annotations to customize JSON output.
MongoDB - Move to snapshot build to benefit from entity scanning defaults.
Infrastructure - Removed Gradle build.
REST - Renamed {rest-exporter => rest}.
Maven, REST - Use snapshot repository for now.
Added REST exporter module.

Cleaned up Gradle build.

Consolidated dependency versions into build.gradle to avoid the indirection and the additional gradle.properties flying around. Added Logback dependency to root project and moved CGLib dependency into it as well. Removed obsolete dependency declarations mostly for Log4J.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book

* 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book:
  Removing oracle example
  Working on examples for Oracle
Added formatter for Eclipse.

JDBC - Fixed code generation setup.

Querydsl now again generates into src/generated/java. Adapted both Maven and Gradle build accordingly.
Created pom.xml files to allow projects to be built using Maven.
JPA - Polished configuration and test case.
JPA - Update to Spring Data Commons 1.2.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book

* 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book:
  More example code for Redis chapter covering PubSub and Caching.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book

* 'master' of https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book:
  cleanup SQL
  Working on examples for Oracle
  Working on examples for Oracle
  Adding equals and hashCode to EmailAddress
  Working on examples for JDBC/Querydsl/Oracle
  Working on examples for JDBC/Querydsl
  Refactoring QueryDSL JDBC example and tests
Neo4j - Fix generics in method declaration in repository.
MongoDB / JPA - Cleanups.
JPA - Adapted to improvement in defaulting of base package for annotation driven repository config.
MongoDB - Upgrade to JavaConfig for repositories.
Build - Maked 'build' default task for all modules.

JPA - Upgrade to JavaConfig.

Pull in snapshot version of JavaConfig coming up in Spring Data JPA. Simplified XML configuration.
MongoDB - Polished sample code and removed obsolete classes.
JPA - Polished LineItem mapping.

JPA - Polished sample code.

Added Javadoc, improved mapping of entities.
Upgrade Gradle build to Spring Data Commons 1.3.1.RELEASE.

Added MongoDB module.

Fixed Neo4J Integration tests. Let Querydsl module work with Maven as I failed to set up a proper APT processor with Gradle.
Upgraded Gradle wrapper to 1.0.

Added submodule for Querydsl.

Show working with Querydsl predicates using the plain collection query functionality. Added bin folder to the Git ignored folders. Build currently only working with Maven.

Build infrastructure.

Fixing Spring versions to 3.1.1 using { forced = true }. The same for Spring Data Commons 1.3.0.RELEASE. Upgraded to Hibernate 4.1.3.Final for JPA module. Removed jdbc module from settings.gradle as it cannot be built without artifacts added to the repo manually and thus breaks the build of the entire project.

Updates to build infrastructure.

Excluded junit:junit dependency to be sure Hamcrest library is used and not the subset of types shipped with JUnit. Switched to SpringSource milestone repository and include Maven Central. Removed superfluous dependency to Spring Context Support. Added global compile time dependency to Spring Data Commons. Move Logback config to redis module for now as we're using Log4j in the other modules currently. Moved version declarations of Spring Data JPA and Hibernate into JPA module. Reduced scopes for JPA module dependencies to the least necessary ones.

JPA - Initial commit for JPA chapter sample code.

Use the pom.xml file for building for now as I couldn't get dependencies resolved correctly for Gradle. Removed log back configuration as the module will use Log4J as logging library.

Added basic mapped domain model as well as infrastructure configuration in JavaConfig and XML. Added basic integration tests to test the mapping. Removed obsolete package-info.java files.

issue_comments.body: Thanks for the pointer. The issue should have become obsolete with https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-data-book/commit/364f659704cbad6da4ac59f22d14ad9e0096f33d.

Sorry for not getting to this earlier. I didn't really consider this as broken as we relied on 1.0.4 which _is_ available in Maven Central. I went ahead and upgraded the dependency to the new artifact in 1.0.8 in all modules using Querydsl. Thanks for spotting this though.
/cc @dturanski
Related: #5

issue_comments.body: This is a benign message. Note that it's a warning message. Gemfire does not throw the exception, merely logs it.

Actually, I just made a change so that by default the RFB doesn't try to close the region in it's destroy method. It appears to be unnecessary, since GF takes care of this internally. I've left it as an option for now.

Removed some IDEA files
Had to add stub package-info files to get directories to show up in git
Initial commit of gradle project

pull_requests.title: Upgrade Apache Commons Collections to v3.2.2
pull_requests.body:
Version 3.2.1 has a CVSS 10.0 vulnerability. That's the worst kind of
vulnerability that exists. By merely existing on the classpath, this
library causes the Java serialization parser for the entire JVM process
to go from being a state machine to a turing machine. A turing machine
with an exec() function!

https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8103
https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-collections/security-reports.html
http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

issue_comments.body:
Neat. Why didn't I think of that? ;-)
I can confirm that it works.
Thanks Oliver!

The book states that @EnableJpaRepositories "includes" the @ComponentScan as well as the @EnableTransactionManagement annotations. Thus the @EnableTransactionManagement annotation should be in PlainJpaConfig instead of InfastructureConfig, as the Spring Data JPA configuration doesn't need it. Other than the book I haven't seen a hint that @EnableJpaRepositories includes those two other annotations, which makes it tricky to understand what's going. However, that could be just me still learning and reading through Spring documentation. Also, as the book mentions, any non-small application will probably use all those annotation anyhow, so I might be overthinking this.

On a related note, what is the advantage of @Import over just extending the base Infastructure class? The later seems simpler and more intuitive to understand to me. Both approaches seem to work and I couldn't found any documentation on why @Import would be preferably (other than allowing to specify more than one class, as would be the limitation when extending. Hm, that's probably my answer).
Good luck @a3692468  - mine has been waiting since December...

However, I really don't understand how to run the examples from STS IDE... any direction would be helpful and I would be tremendously thankful.

Strange, as I can [see](http://m2.neo4j.org/service/local/repositories/releases/content/org/neo4j/neo4j-cypher-dsl/1.8/neo4j-cypher-dsl-1.8.jar) it in [nexus](http://m2.neo4j.org/index.html#view-repositories;releases~browsestorage)

```
[WARNING] The POM for org.neo4j:neo4j-cypher-dsl:jar:1.8 is missing, no dependency information available
Downloading: http://m2.neo4j.org/releases/org/neo4j/neo4j-cypher-dsl/1.8/neo4j-cypher-dsl-1.8.jar
Downloading: http://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/org/neo4j/neo4j-cypher-dsl/1.8/neo4j-cypher-dsl-1.8.jar
```

UPD: seems some issues with their repo (and 1.8 is not in maven central yet). As a workaround you may install jar locally

```
mvn install:install-file -Dfile=neo4j-cypher-dsl-1.8.jar -DgroupId=org.neo4j -DartifactId=neo4j-cypher-dsl -Dversion=1.8 -Dpackaging=jar
```
